crazyballrun.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game-Class initializes and runs the Game-Engines. It has a "getInstance"- Method (singleton pattern) to ensure there's just one instance of Game.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Game.GameMode
      Specifies the game mode.
      static class  Game.GameState
      Enumeration of all game states.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void endGame()
      Exit the game.
      Game.GameMode getGameMode()
      Reads the GameMode from the GameSettings.
      Game.GameState getGameState()
      Gets the current state of the game.
      static Game getInstance()
      Provides access to the game.
      boolean isMultiplayer()
      Checks if the game is a multiplayer game (NOT splitscreen!).
      boolean isSingleplayer()
      Checks if the game is a singleplayer game (includes splitscreen!).
      void setGameState(Game.GameState state)
      Sets the current game state.
      void startGame()
      Initializes and runs the game.

      • getInstance

        Provides access to the game.
        Returns:

      • isSingleplayer

        public boolean isSingleplayer()
        Checks if the game is a singleplayer game (includes splitscreen!).
        Returns:
        "true" if the game is singleplayer

      • isMultiplayer

        public boolean isMultiplayer()
        Checks if the game is a multiplayer game (NOT splitscreen!).
        Returns:
        "true" if game is multiplayer

      • getGameMode

        public Game.GameMode getGameMode()
        Reads the GameMode from the GameSettings.
        Returns:
        game mode (SP, MP, Campagne, Splitscreen, Match, ...)
